intro: Eustephia armifera, commonly known as the armed stephia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions in southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are often lobed and can have a slightly aromatic scent. Eustephia armifera is generally found in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
